intro: Sideroxylon ellipticum, commonly known as the African ironwood tree, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to tropical Africa. It is a large evergreen tree that can grow up to 30 meters tall, characterized by its dense, hard wood that is highly valued for its durability. The leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and arranged oppositely on the branches. The flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and clustered in inflorescences, while the fruit is a small, dry capsule containing several seeds. This plant is well adapted to dry conditions and plays an important ecological role in its native habitats.
